excerpt: Set in the Muong Hoa Valley, Cat Cat Village is known for its natural beauty, and H'mong culture and traditions. Traditional wood huts, some serving as homestays, overlook mountainside rice field terraces. On Si Bridge, visitors pass stalls selling H'mong handicrafts, homemade corn wine, and naturally dyed clothes on the way to Tien Sa waterfalls. Cultural shows are performed at the Nhà Hàng Dũng Thu center.
detail_description: Nestled in the picturesque Muong Hoa Valley, Cat Cat Village is a charming destination renowned for its natural splendor and rich H'mong culture. Visitors can stay in traditional wooden huts overlooking terraced rice fields or explore Si Bridge, where local vendors sell handmade crafts, corn wine, and naturally dyed clothing on the way to Tien Sa waterfalls. The village also offers cultural shows at the Nhà Hàng Dũng Thu center.
name: Cat Cat Village
address: San Sả Hồ, Sa Pa, Lao Cai, Vietnam

detail_description: Silver Waterfall is a must-see natural beauty spot in Sapa, Vietnam. Located 14km from Sapa on the winding O Qui Ho Pass, it offers a stunning view of the cascading waterfall running down from Lo Sui Tong mountain peak. The best way to experience its beauty is by trekking up 300 steps to a bridge that provides a captivating panoramic view of the waterfall and surrounding mountains.
name: Silver Waterfall Sa Pa
address: San Sả Hồ, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

excerpt: Peak overlooking Sapa with a meandering hike amid lush vegetation to its dragon head–shaped summit.
detail_description: Khu Du Lịch Sinh Thái Hàm Rồng SaPa, also known as Ham Rong Mountain, is a prominent peak in Sapa town. Its dragon head–shaped summit offers breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape. The hike to the 1900m-high summit is relatively easy, with steps leading up through lush vegetation and a stunning flower garden featuring numerous orchid varieties.
name: Ham Rong Sa Pa Eco-Tourism Area
address: Đường Lên, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

excerpt: This popular road weaves through the scenic valley landscape with terraced vineyards & villages.
detail_description: Muong Hoa Valley is a picturesque destination in Sapa, Vietnam, known for its stunning landscape of terraced vineyards and traditional villages. The valley is home to various ethnic minorities such as Tay, Dzay, Black Hmong, and Red Dzao who have preserved their traditional cultures and customs. Visitors can embark on hiking adventures through the valley to witness the breathtaking rice terraces and immerse themselves in the unique cultures of the local tribes.
name: Mường Hoa
address: Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

detail_description: Love Waterfall, nestled within the Hoang Lien National Park, is a stunning 100-meter cascade that glistens like silver in the sunlight as it plunges into the Gold Stream. The surrounding scenery is equally enchanting, with the stream winding through lush greenery and bamboo clusters. To reach this natural wonder, visitors must embark on a picturesque hike through bamboo forests and rhododendron-filled landscapes, offering breathtaking views of the Hoang Lien mountain range.
name: Love Waterfall
address: 8QWC+RV8, Sơn Bình, Tam Đường, Lai Châu, Vietnam

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Sapa town in northern Vietnam, the Sapa Culture Museum, also known as the Sapa Museum, offers a captivating journey into the rich traditions and history of local communities. Established in 2007, this museum features an array of exhibits including artifacts, photographs, and interactive displays that shed light on the distinctive cultural heritage of Sapa and its neighboring regions.
name: Sapa Culture Museum
address: 02 Fansipan, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

excerpt: 50-km-long mountain pass usually topped with clouds & known for valley & forest views.
detail_description: Ô Quy Hồ Pass, also known as Heaven Gate or Tram Ton Pass, is a 50-kilometer-long mountain pass in Vietnam that offers breathtaking views of valleys and forests. As the highest point in Ô Quy Hồ Pass at 1900 meters, Tram Ton provides a stunning vantage point to admire the Hoang Lien mountain range and the snaking roads below.
name: Ô Quy Hồ pass
address: Sơn Bình, Tam Đường District, Lai Chau, Vietnam

excerpt: Sa Pa is a town in the Hoàng Liên Son Mountains of northwestern Vietnam. A popular trekking base, it overlooks the terraced rice fields of the Muong Hoa Valley, and is near the 3,143m-tall Phang Xi Pang peak, which is climbable via a steep, multiday guided walk. Hill tribes, such as the Hmong, Tay and Dao, make up much of the town's local population.
detail_description: Sa Pa, located in the Hoàng Liên Son Mountains of northwestern Vietnam, is a popular destination for trekking and exploring the terraced rice fields of the Muong Hoa Valley. The town offers a cool climate year-round and is home to various hill tribes such as the Hmong, Tay, and Dao. Visitors can experience diverse natural beauty throughout the seasons, from snowfall in winter to blooming flowers in spring and golden rice terraces in autumn.
name: Sa Pa
address: Lao Cai, Vietnam

detail_description: Sin Chai Village is situated near Sapa town and can be reached by a full-day hike. It is home to the Black Hmong ethnic group and offers an authentic experience compared to the more touristy Cat Cat village. The village retains its pristine beauty, surrounded by rice terraces and maize upland farming. Visitors can witness traditional houses, weaving practices, and the stunning Cat Cat waterfall while exploring this less touristic but culturally rich destination.
name: Sin Chai Village
address: 8RJH+FQ6, Cát Cát, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

excerpt: Town center lake with a footpath & lively cafes around its rim, plus views of surrounding peaks.
detail_description: Sa Pa Lake is a picturesque man-made lake in the town center, offering a leisurely footpath and bustling cafes along its perimeter. Fed by natural water from Hoang Lien mountain, it provides stunning views of the surrounding peaks and Sapa town. Visitors can enjoy morning exercises or simply relax at the lakeside cafes while taking in the serene beauty of the area.
name: Sa Pa Lake
address: Sa Pa, Lao Cai, Vietnam

detail_description: Sapa Night Market is a bustling center for goods and cultural exchange, where the Hmong, Dao, and Nung ethnic minorities gather. Located in the heart of Sapa on Luong Dinh Cua Street, this vibrant market offers a wide array of hand-made products, pharmaceuticals, forestry items, and traditional brocade clothing. Visitors can explore an interesting collection of goods including chestnut stuffed pastries, local food stands, and electronics.
name: Sa Pa Night Market
address: Lương Định Của, Sa Pả, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

excerpt: Built by the French in 1895, this stone church features a belltower & Roman Gothic architecture.
detail_description: Notre Dame Cathedral is a stunning stone church with a belltower and Roman Gothic architecture, built by the French in 1895. It's located in Sapa, Vietnam, a beloved destination known for its troubled past and recovery. Visitors can explore nearby attractions like the Sapa Museum, Cat Cat Village, and Ham Rong Mountain within walking distance. The cathedral area offers an eerie atmosphere in the early morning fog, surrounded by Hmong ethnic people making a living.
name: Sapa Church
address: P. Hàm Rồng, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai 333100, Vietnam

excerpt: Aerial cable cars between Sapa & Fansipan Peak, with temples, restaurants & shops at either end.
detail_description: Ga cáp treo SUN WORLD FANSIPAN LEGEND is a cultural and religious tourism area situated on the peak of Fansipan, the highest in Indochina. It boasts a modern cable car system that allows visitors to conquer the peak in just 15 minutes. The site features unique architectural works such as pagodas and Buddha statues. Nestled within the Hoang Lien Mountain Range, it offers leisure activities, attractions, and comfortable lodging.
name: Cable Car Station – Sun World Fansipan Legend
address: 89B Nguyễn Chí Thanh, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

detail_description: Sapa Market, located in the center of Sapa town in Vietnam, has a rich history dating back to before the French colonial era. It used to be situated 7 km east of the current town location and served as a vital meeting point for ethnic minorities like Hmong and Red Zao peoples. The market takes place every Sunday and offers an opportunity to witness various hill tribes showcasing their traditional attire and exchanging local products.
name: Sapa Market

detail_description: Sapa Love Market is a distinctive cultural event in Lao Cai that should not be missed when visiting the area. Similar to love markets in Khau Vai and Moc Chau, this event used to occur annually after Tet holiday but now takes place every Saturday evening, drawing both local and international visitors. If you're keen on exploring Sapa's cultural heritage, the love market offers a unique experience.
name: Sapa-Love-Market
address: Vietnam, Lào Cai, Sa Pa

detail_description: Sapa Heaven Gate, located about 3 kilometers from Bac Waterfall, is a breathtaking natural wonder. The pass path to the gate, known as Tram Ton, winds through the Hoang Lien Son mountain range and offers stunning views of terraced valleys and the distant Bac Waterfall shrouded in clouds. Travelers can continue 3 km further from Silver Falls to reach Heaven Gate for panoramic vistas of Lai Chau valley and Fansipan peak.
name: Sapa Heaven Gate
address: 9Q28+W5R, Sơn Bình, Tam Đường, Lai Châu, Vietnam

detail_description: Located in the Sapa district, Đập thuỷ điện Ý Linh Hồ is a beautiful destination that not many Vietnamese tourists visit. The path to the village can be challenging and muddy, making it more suitable for experienced motorbike riders. However, the journey offers stunning views of the dam from the bridge and an opportunity to trek through picturesque landscapes with terraced fields and mountain slopes adorned with beautiful flowers.
name: Đập thuỷ điện Ý Linh Hồ
address: 8V65+2XV, Lao Chải, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

detail_description: Ta Van village is a serene and authentic ethnic minority village located in Sapa, Vietnam. It's known for its local beauty and culture, nestled in a valley with stunning landscapes including mountains, waterways, and rice paddies. The village offers lovely homestays, bars, and local cafes where visitors can experience the indigenous way of life. One of the highlights is the range of ancient houses found here, such as Mr.
name: Ta Van
address: 8RPV+P48, Xuân Viên, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

detail_description: The Hmong Sisters Restobar is a beloved spot in Sa Pa, known for its tranquil atmosphere and simple yet authentic decor featuring natural materials like bamboo, wood, and thatch. It's a favorite among those seeking to escape the hustle and bustle of the town. The bar offers a spacious setting compared to others in the area, with meticulous and historically inspired design. Visitors can enjoy a variety of colorful cocktails while chilling out with friends or partake in scheduled music performances and billiards.
name: The Hmong Sisters - Restobar
address: 31 Mường Hoa, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

detail_description: Le Gecko Café, also known as 'The Gecko Cafe', is a versatile French-owned establishment in Sapa. It serves as a hotel, café, restaurant, and bar at night. The café offers a picturesque view of Fansipan mountain and Sapa Lake from its comfortable patio with wooden chairs. Visitors can savor Lavazza coffee and indulge in nama chocolate at an affordable price.
name: Le Gecko Café
address: 02 Ngũ Chỉ Sơn, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai 330000, Vietnam

detail_description: The Hill Station Deli & Boutique in Sapa is a charming spot to enjoy lunch with a focus on local produce. Established by two Danish individuals who were captivated by Sapa and Vietnam, the deli offers an array of locally-made buffalo cheeses, air-dried beef, hams, terrines, and smoked salmon and trout. The inspiration behind this establishment was Sapa's history as a French colonial hill station.
name: The Hill Station Deli & Boutique
address: 07 Mường Hoa, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

detail_description: Nhà Hàng Cơm Hoa Đào Sa Pa is conveniently located in the heart of Sapa, offering a delightful dining experience with stunning views of the Sapa Flower Park. Just a short walk away, visitors can also explore interesting attractions such as the local market and the stone church. The restaurant is known for its generous portions and delectable dishes, including the highly recommended Salmon and Sturgeon hotpot.
name: Nhà Hàng Cơm Hoa Đào Sa Pa
address: 49 Lê Văn Tám, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

detail_description: In the mountainous province of Lao Cai in Northwest Vietnam, Ham Rong is a renowned attraction alongside other popular sites like Fansipan and Love Waterfall. A visit to Lao Cai would not be complete without exploring Bac Ha market, offering an opportunity for an adventurous journey and a glimpse into the rich indigenous cultures of the highlanders.
name: Ham Rong
address: Sa Pa, Lao Cai, Vietnam

detail_description: Nhà hàng Khám Phá Việt (Thắng cố A Quỳnh) is a must-visit restaurant in Sapa, Vietnam. It offers the traditional savory stew known as thang co, which includes a variety of meats like horse, buffalo, pork, and beef simmered with herbs and spices. This dish exemplifies the communal spirit of Sapa's indigenous communities and is traditionally prepared during gatherings and festivals.
name: Thang co A Quynh Restaurant
address: 15 Đ. Thạch Sơn, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

detail_description: The Sapa Love Market is a vibrant cultural hub in Sapa, Vietnam, where young people from various ethnic backgrounds come together to celebrate love and romance. This enchanting gathering offers a glimpse into the traditional courtship practices of the Hmong, Dao, and Giay communities. Visitors can enjoy colorful costumes, lively music, and captivating dance performances that showcase the rich cultural heritage of these groups. The atmosphere is filled with excitement as attendees engage in social interactions that may lead to budding romances.
name: Sapa Love Market
address: 02 Phan Si Păng, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai 330000, Vietnam

detail_description: Sapa's Farmers Market is a bustling hub where locals sell an array of goods, from souvenirs to bulk items like tea, dried fruit, coffee, and nuts. The market also features a section for cooked foods, with many stalls offering delicious noodle soups with pork. Here you can find fresh produce sold by local villagers from nearby hamlets at reasonable prices.
name: Farmers market Sapa
address: 9V99+7CJ, Sa Pả, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

detail_description: Thác Bạc, also known as Silver Waterfall, is a stunning natural attraction located in the Sapa region of Vietnam. The waterfall cascades down from a height of 200 meters, creating a mesmerizing sight and a soothing sound that resonates through the surrounding lush greenery. Visitors can take a leisurely hike to reach the waterfall, passing through picturesque landscapes and enjoying the fresh mountain air.
name: Thác Bạc
address: Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

detail_description: When visiting the charming Cat Cat village in Sapa, don't miss the opportunity to explore the lush surroundings and encounter an abundance of Rau ca meo. The friendly MNong people warmly welcome visitors and offer delicious local dishes such as steamed rice and Stir-fried Rau ca meo with fat and ginger, providing a taste of authentic Vietnamese cuisine amidst stunning natural beauty.
name: Cat Cat
address: Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

detail_description: Cộng Cà Phê is a well-known brand that evokes nostalgia with its coffee inspired by Vietnam's subsidy period. The Sapa location adds a fresh twist to the familiar cafe scene in the misty town, offering a unique experience. Visitors rave about the refreshing and delicious coconut cacao and coconut mung bean drinks, perfect for enjoying on the balcony while people-watching in the cold weather of Sapa.
name: Cộng Cà Phê
address: 27 Ng. Cầu Mây, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

detail_description: Located in Sapa town, Lao Cai, right next to Hoang Lien National Park, Swing SaPa is a popular destination for tourists and a hotspot for social media check-ins. The place offers picturesque scenery even during the cold and foggy season. One of its main attractions is the double statue reminiscent of those found in Bali. Visitors can purchase tickets that come with a complimentary drink and spend around 30 minutes to an hour taking photos.
name: Swing Sapa
address: 98 Nguyễn Chí Thanh, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

detail_description: Sun World Fansipan Legend is a must-visit spring travel destination, offering stunning views of the misty scenery and the colorful Buddhist flag road. It's located on Fansipan Peak, known as the 'Roof of Indochina,' with an altitude of 3,143m. The site provides access to the majestic natural landscapes of Northwest mountains and forests.
name: Sun World Fansipan Legend
address: 89B Nguyễn Chí Thanh, Phường Fansipan, Sa Pa, Lào Cai 00842, Vietnam

detail_description: Sapa Trekking Hiking Tours offers an unforgettable experience exploring the stunning landscapes and local villages of Sapa. The central location of Dragon Jaw Mountain makes it easily accessible by foot, providing breathtaking views and ample photo opportunities. The knowledgeable guides, such as Gio, are passionate about sharing their culture and traditions with visitors. The serene atmosphere and lush surroundings offer a refreshing escape from city life, leaving travelers with cherished memories and a desire to return to this peaceful paradise.
name: Sapa Trekking Hiking Tours
address: 158 Đường Điện Biên Phủ, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai 31700, Vietnam

detail_description: Sapa Ancient Rock Field, located in the picturesque Muong Hoa valley, is a fascinating historical site discovered by a Russian French archaeologist in the 1920s. Spanning about 8 square kilometers and featuring nearly 200 stone blocks with intricate carvings, this ancient rock field offers visitors a glimpse into the lives of prehistoric people. The museum nearby showcases samples of the carved rocks and provides insights into their discovery and significance.
name: Sapa Ancient Rock Field
address: 8VF3+FP9, Lao Chải, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

detail_description: The Sapa Tourist Information Center is a fantastic resource for travelers looking to explore the stunning landscapes and rich culture of Sapa. This local government office warmly welcomes visitors, providing free information and assistance in multiple languages. Whether you're interested in booking a trek or homestay, the center offers excellent value for money with fixed prices that ensure transparency. Many have found their trekking packages to be both affordable and enriching, complete with delicious meals along the way.
name: Sapa Tourist Information Center
address: 2 Fansipan, street, Sa Pa, Lào Cai 330000, Vietnam

detail_description: Quang Truong Square, located in the heart of Sapa city, is a bustling gathering place for neighboring tribes who come together for trade and social activities. Every Saturday evening, the Love Market brings the Hmong and Dao tribes together for games and matchmaking. The square also hosts events like the Lantern Festival and offers traditional handicrafts for sale.
name: Quang Truong Square
address: 38 Ng. Cầu Mây, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

detail_description: Little Sapa Restaurant is a charming eatery that offers a diverse menu filled with the tantalizing flavors of Sapa. The dishes, including grilled pork skewers, spring rolls, and pho, are prepared using traditional Vietnamese cooking methods by skilled chefs. Additionally, staying at a local homestay provides an immersive cultural experience where guests can participate in sourcing food for meals and learning to cook regional specialties.
name: Little Sapa restaurant
address: 05 Đ. Đông Lợi, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai 33000, Vietnam

detail_description: The Red Dzao House, located in Ta Phin Village, is a cultural center that provides an immersive experience into the traditions of the Red Dzao ethnic minority group. This unique attraction offers traditional dance performances, handicraft demonstrations, and cultural workshops. Visitors can engage in activities such as weaving and batik while learning about the Red Dzao's distinct way of life. Additionally, guests can savor local specialties at this renowned restaurant on Thac Bac Street near Victoria Hotel.
name: Red Dzao House
address: 4b Thác Bạc, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai 333100, Vietnam

detail_description: Sapa Sky View Restaurant & Bar, located on the seventh floor of Chau Long Sapa Hotel, offers a stunning panoramic view of the Northwest mountains. With a capacity for about 200 guests, this rustic yet elegant establishment allows visitors to immerse themselves in the breathtaking scenery of the Muong Hoa valley and Mount Fansipan.
name: Sapa sky view restaurant and bar
address: 24 Đ. Đông Lợi, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai 333101, Vietnam

detail_description: Cộng Cafe has expanded to Sapa, offering the same vintage decor and old photographs that are characteristic of its Hanoi locations. The cafe is conveniently located in the heart of the city, making it easily accessible for tourists. With a stunning view of the Hoang Lien Son mountain range, Cộng Cafe in Sapa provides an ideal spot to relax and enjoy a cocktail while taking in the majestic natural scenery.
name: Cong Coffee
address: 37 Xuân Viên, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

detail_description: Baguette and Chocolate is a charming spot located just 5 minutes from the town's church. It features a mini hotel with four beautifully decorated French-style rooms, as well as a cafe serving both Vietnamese and Western cuisine, along with delectable French pastries and beverages. The friendly staff provides excellent service, including storing belongings for guests and allowing the use of facilities even after check-out. Visitors rave about the delightful chocolate tart and cakes offered at this cozy establishment.
name: Baguette and chocolate
address: 4 Thác Bạc Sa Pả Sa Pa Sa Pả Sa Pa Lào Cai, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

excerpt: Traditional clay mountain homes with serene rooms, plus dining, yoga, cooking classes & a spa.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Sapa, Sapa Clay House Mountain Retreat is a delightful haven that beautifully blends traditional charm with modern comforts. This eco-friendly accommodation draws inspiration from the H'mong people's traditional clay homes, utilizing locally sourced materials to create a rustic yet cozy atmosphere. Guests can unwind in serene rooms adorned with earthy tones and wooden accents while enjoying breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains and valleys.
name: Sapa Clay House
address: Lao Chải, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

detail_description: Nhà Hàng Bản Phố is renowned for its specialty dishes from the Northwest region, such as grilled wild boar meat, various fish dishes, and hotpot with local ingredients. The restaurant offers a stunning view of Nu Ham Rong, creating a spacious and serene atmosphere. Despite its simple decor, the delicious food and beautiful scenery always attract a steady stream of customers. Additionally, the staff's excellent English skills make it welcoming for international visitors.
name: Nhà Hàng Bản Phố
address: 17 Lê Văn Tám, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai 330000, Vietnam

detail_description: ETHOS is a tour operator that specialises in customised trips to different parts of Vietnam. They pride themselves on offering excellent customer service and ensuring that every traveller has a truly memorable experience. Their tours are designed to allow maximum freedom for travellers, with each tailored specifically to their interests. Whether you're looking for a scenic walk through Sa Pa or an informative explore of its markets, ETHOS can help make your stay in Vietnam unforgettable.
name: ETHOS - Spirit of the Community
address: Số 79 đường Nguyễn Chí Thanh, Sa Pa, Lào Cai 333311, Vietnam

detail_description: Nhà Hàng Cầu Mây, situated in the heart of Sapa city on Ngu Chi Son Street, is a popular spot offering a variety of Northwest specialties. The restaurant is known for its delicious Thang Co, grilled chicks, ribs with fried dumplings, Da Nang rays grilled with green chili salt, and smoked duck breast salad. The fresh and safe ingredients used in their dishes have made it a favorite among locals and tourists alike.
name: Nhà Hàng Cầu Mây
address: 172 Đ. Thạch Sơn, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

detail_description: Sun Plaza Sapa is a popular tourist attraction located in the heart of Sapa town. The striking green and yellow building features classical European architecture, often likened to a splendid Parisian construction. It has become a well-known check-in spot for young people and is just steps away from the Stone Church. The nostalgic and dreamy ambiance, regardless of the weather, makes it an iconic landmark in Sapa.
name: Sun Plaza Sapa
address: Vietnam, Lào Cai, Sa Pa, Ng. Cầu Mây

detail_description: Núi Xẻ Ranger Station Trạm Tôn is a must-visit in Sapa, Vietnam, offering an exhilarating experience for adventure enthusiasts. It is the highest mountain pass in the country, situated 1,900 meters above sea level and located just 18 kilometers north of Sapa. This spot serves as the starting point for trekking to Fansipan summit and offers breathtaking views of the surrounding landscapes.
name: Núi Xẻ Ranger Station Trạm Tôn
address: 9Q3F+6W3, QL4D, San Sả Hồ, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

detail_description: Viet Emotion SaPa is a charming café located in Sapa, offering a unique blend of Hoi An's nostalgic essence and the Northwestern highlands' character. The café's interior features warm yellow tones, green wooden doors, and vibrant lanterns that transport visitors to the streets of old Hoi An. Situated on Cau May Street, this café provides an opportunity to immerse oneself in the daily life of Sapa while enjoying a cup of coffee amidst picturesque surroundings.
name: Viet Emotion SaPa
address: 017 Xuân Viên, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai 333104, Vietnam

excerpt: Peak overlooking Sapa with a meandering hike amid lush vegetation to its dragon head–shaped summit.
detail_description: Resort Ham Rong is a unique spot that defies its name, as it's not exactly a resort but rather an informal park area located at the foot of Ham Rong Mountain. The 148-hectare tourist area, established in 1996, fully embraces the natural beauty of mossy stone forests and perennial peach forests. As you ascend the mountain, you'll be treated to stunning scenery that will inspire your sense of adventure.
name: Ham Rong Sa Pa Eco-Tourism Area
address: Đường Lên, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai, Vietnam

detail_description: Moana Sapa is a popular entertainment complex in Sapa, attracting many young tourists with its unique styles and impressive architecture. The complex reopened in mid-March after two years of isolation and offers superb location photo spots, including a Balinese gate, female face sculpture, infinity swing, and piano. While there is an entrance fee of 80k VND per person, the stunning photo props and lovely photographic destinations make it worth the visit.
name: Moana Sapa
address: số 68 Violet, Phường Cầu Mây, Sa Pa, Lào Cai 330000, Vietnam

detail_description: Quảng Trường Hồ Sa Pa, situated in the picturesque highlands of northern Vietnam, is a vibrant hub that captures the essence of local life. This lively square serves as a gathering spot for both locals and visitors, showcasing an array of cultural events, traditional dances, and mouthwatering street food. On weekends, it buzzes with activity as residents come together to relax or engage in sports like football and volleyball.
name: Sapa Lake Square
address: Xuân Viên, TT. Sa Pa, Sa Pa, Lào Cai 33000, Vietnam
